Confirmation from the Clinton Foundation: The expert reached out to the Clinton Foundation to verify the claim and they confirmed that they did not own or operate any cargo ships, thus debunking the story.
Origins of the story: The expert traced the origin of the claim to TheLastLineOfDefense.org, a parody website known for publishing fake news stories. This website has been previously flagged for spreading false information.
Lack of credible sources: The article in question cited DailyUsaUpdate.com as its source, a site known for trafficking in bogus news articles. This lack of credible sources raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Inconsistencies and absurdities: The expert pointed out several inconsistencies and absurdities in the claim, such as the inclusion of a Photoshopped image and a link to a meme instead of a legitimate CNN story. These elements further undermine the credibility of the claim.
